newsitem.title: USA: CIGNA LOWERS RIGHTS PLAN TRIGGER TO 10 PERCENT.
newsitem.headline: CIGNA LOWERS RIGHTS PLAN TRIGGER TO 10 PERCENT.

text.p: CIGNA Corp said on Wednesday it adopted a new shareholders rights plan that lowers the trigger to 10 percent from 20 percent.
Company officials said they were not responding to any impending takeover attempt, but merely updating the plan that has been in place since 1987.
That plan was due to expire in August, the company said in a news release.
The new plan would take effect if an investor or group acquired 10 percent or more of CIGNA's outstanding shares.
CIGNA provides health care, insurance and related financial services. Wednesday, 23 July 1997 20:42:59 ENDS nN23133808
